name: electricity production, photovoltaic, 570kWp open ground installation, multi-Si | electricity, low voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25545/documentation

This dataset represents the production of grid-connected low voltage electricity with a 570 kWp open ground photovoltaic (PV) plant. Large central photovoltaic power stations in the higher kilowatt to megawatt range can feed directly into the medium- or high voltage grid. However, the voltage depends largely on the design and size of the plant. In order to treat all photovoltaic installations the same way (no matter which size, design and installation type (building integrated or open ground)), low voltage electricity is assumed as a product in this dataset. Please see field 'extrapolations' for further discussion. ;The plant consists out of multi-Si panel modules with a total capacity of 570 kWp.  ;An inverter is used to convert the low voltage DC power into AC power. 

From the PV module installed and ready to be used.

This activity ends with low voltage electricity produced with the 570 kWp module, assuming an average yield. 

This dataset includes tap water use for cleaning the module and its treatment.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The annual production volume valid for 2012
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity production with a grid-connected 570 kWp multi-Si photovoltaic open ground installation. See field 'extrapolation' for comment on the output voltage.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The simplifying assumption was made that all electricity is directly provided as low voltage electricity, so that no transformation has to take place. Even in countries with high shares of open ground installations (where medium or high voltage electricity might arrive at the busbar), the error introduced due to this assumption is not significant, as transformation processes do only have a low influence on environmental impacts.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Lifetime*capacity*annual yield = y * kWp/unit * kWh/(kWp*y) = kWh/unit and then the reciproke.

exchanges.description: Energy loss in the system is included.

Calculated value. Amount of installation needed to produce 1 kWh * panel area per installation * water need to clean 1 m2 of panel. [unit/kWh * m2/unit * l/m2 = l/kWh]. A density of 1 kg/dm3 is assumed.
